subject: Re: Help setting up JUnit
msgSnippet: Not explicitly, but I did not think that was necessary. There wasn t anything about it in the JUnit docs. The file is in the directory junit tests runner under

Not explicitly, but I did not think that was necessary. There wasn't 
anything about it in the JUnit docs. The file is in the directory 
junit\tests\runner under my base classpath directory, and the 
reference within the call is to junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar, 
which is correct from the base classpath. I tried adding it in 
explicitly without success.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Pardey, Craig" <CRAIG.PARDEY@t...> 
wrote:
> 
> test.jar is in your classpath, right?
> 
> Craig
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: dinglek2004 [mailto:dinglek@h...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 28, 2004 1:50 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: Help setting up JUnit
> 
> 
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Pardey, Craig" <CRAIG.PARDEY@t...> 
> wrote:
> > 
> > Try including the current directory (".") in your classpath, as 
> well as the junit directory
> > 
> > CLASSPATH=.;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1
> \junit.jar;C:\Program Files\j2sdk_nb\j2sdk1.4.2\junit3.8.1
> > 
> > Craig
> > 
> 
> Thanks. Careless error on my part. I had the classpath set to "." 
> before download JUnit, and did not notice I had overwritten it.
> 
> Tests now run, but I receive one error:
> -----JUnit output------
> There was 1 error:
> 1) testJarClassLoading(junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest)
> java.lang.Clas
> sNotFoundException: junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar
>         at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
> (TestCaseClassLoader.
> java:124)
>         at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass
> (TestCaseClassLoader.java:1
> 01)
>         at 
> junit.tests.runner.TestCaseClassLoaderTest.testJarClassLoading
(TestCa
> seClassLoaderTest.java:33)
>         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native 
> Method)
>         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown 
> Source)
>         at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown 
> Source)
> -------------------------
> 
> This is the test for loadClass. It is looking for the class 
> LoadedFromJar in the file test.jar. I checked and the file exists, 
> has the class (checked with WinZip), and the file is loaded (added 
> an assertNotNull to check).
> I have not used this function before. Any ideas on why it would 
fail 
> or criticality of this? Thanks for the help.
> 
> 
> 
>
